name: In Dreams, I Follow
description: The Romantics of the early 1800s believed that one’s identity was greater something greater than the sum of one’s parts. Once memories and manners were stripped away—once a person was removed from the constraints of society, a “core” self would be revealed. Some intangible, ineffable piece of a person that makes them unique and alive. So step in and remove your seven dressings, dear reader. Let us find out what rests inside you.
